page.title: 19SERVICES (SHOPPING)
page.content: The community is served by shops in Askrigg and Bainbridge. In Askrigg there is a general store, a newsagents and toursist shop run by the Askrigg Foundation and a Post Office. In Bainbridge, the Post Office and General Stores are combined. There is also a butcher and one of the garages acts as a newsagent. In addition, travelling shops visit the villages and hamlets from Hawes and a weekly laundry/dry cleaning service is available from Lancaster. Much of the community's general shopping is done in Hawes (4 miles away) and Leyburn (13 miles away) on Market days. The towns of Richmond, Northallerton, Darlington, Ripon, Lancaster and Kendal are used for larger commodities.
